title: spec: inconsistent about allowed string conversions
body:
In the Conversions section, the bullet list says:

A non-constant value x can be converted to type T in any of these cases:
...
 • x is an integer or has type []byte or []rune and T is a string type.
 • x is a string and T is []byte or []rune.

suggesting that named []byte and named []rune are not okay. But then below under the
subheading "Conversions to and from a string type" it makes clear that named
[]byte and named []rune are in fact okay. The bullet entries should probably say slice
of byte and slice of rune or else 'underlying type'.
